page.title: 18CIVIL WAR POEM BOVEY TRACEY
page.content: {ON THE 9th JANUARY 1646 THERE WAS A {BATTLE BETWEEN PARLIAMENTARY AND {ROYALIST TROOPS THE SITE OF THE BATTLE {IS NOW INDICATED BY A CROSS ON BOVEY {HEATH (823767)} Oliver Cromwell started a Battle Between the Royalist and Roundheads Many a soldier found his death bed The screams were horrific The villagers in their fright Turned and ran away into the winters night The horses and men that lay on the ground Many a friend was not to be found The sound of the cannon Made a tremendous boom And made certain death To many who were doomed A cross is all that is left To remind us where many a soldier Met his death.
